101.description: Join us for a discussion and demonstration of apps and websites available to promote wellbeing
101.title: Digital Wellbeing

102.description: Haptics, tactile sensation, sex toys, immersion.
102.title: Building a better haptic interface.

103.description: Join us for conversation as we enjoy food and drink!
103.title: Lunch

104.description: We will cover a number of tips for improving your Linux experience, by configuring and customizing the operating system and various key applications (bash/zsh, tmux, xterm, ranger file manager), and making these tweaks portable across machines.
104.title: Customizing Linux: Desktop environments, window managers, shells, and scripts

105.description: We will explore how to get started developing web applications using Ruby on Rails.  We will walk through the installation of the necessary tools, then build and deploy a simple app on the web.
105.title: Getting started with Ruby on Rails

106.description: What is a Microcontroller? What can it do? Why should I care? All this will be explained and more as we take a quick trip in the wonderful world of Microcontrollers.
106.title: Micro-controllers 101

107.description:
I'm going to be teaching a little class about automated testing in JavaScript for College Boreal on the 19th of Nov. and wanted to demonstrate it before it to have practice with a group of people, also hopefully get some feedback.
The example page will already be done and it'll be just a "git pull" away, the page will be a library of animals that has some CRUD functionality.
The work is to build a client-side filter system for the data based on their weight, species and diet properties. We'll be using Jasmine to test these filters and other functionally need applied.
107.title: Automated Testing w/Jasmine

speakers.bio: Advocate in reducing mental health stigma while promoting resilliency. My self-care routine consists of tea, bubble baths, and unicorns.
speakers.name: Kelsey Marshman
speakers.shortBio: Registered Social Worker. Master's degree in social work.
speakers.title: Registered Social Worker

speakers.bio: My undergrad is in psychology, neuroscience and behaviour, my Master's is in computational sciences and I have started a company, HapSys to commercialize my research in haptics
speakers.name: Kacey Cayen

speakers.bio: I write code and read novels.
speakers.name: Korey MacDougall

speakers.bio: I am a Master's student at Laurentian with a passion for all things involving computers. My area of study is human computer interaction and videogames.
speakers.name: Stefan Klaassen
speakers.shortBio: I am a Master's student at Laurentian with a passion for all things involving computers. My area of study is human computer interaction and videogames.
speakers.title: Student
